intro: Chrysanthemum darwasicum, commonly known as the Darwasi chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, gray-green leaves and vibrant yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
